messages.content: Comfy-Plasma is a simple plasma noise generator for ComfyUI that allows the generation of various types of noise.
What types of noise can be generated using Comfy-Plasma?
Comfy-Plasma can generate plasma noise, random noise, greyscale noise, pink noise, and brown noise.
What are the key parameters of the Plasma Noise node?
The key parameters of the Plasma Noise node include Width, Height, Turbulence, Value Min/Max, Red Min/Max, Green Min/Max, Blue Min/Max, and Seed.
How does the Turbulence parameter affect the noise in the Plasma Noise node?
The Turbulence parameter scales the noise clouds, with lower values resulting in smoother, larger clouds and higher values resulting in more static-like noise.
How does the Seed parameter work across different noise nodes in Comfy-Plasma?
The Seed parameter ensures a specific noise seed is replicated on every execution, and can have settings such as Fixed, Increment, Decrement, and Randomize.
What is the purpose of the Plasma KSampler node?
The Plasma KSampler node takes a noise seed and creates a resolved image based on the progressive growing of the noise.
What parameters are available in the Plasma KSampler node?
Available parameters in the Plasma KSampler node include Noise Seed, Control After Generate, Steps, CFG, Denoise, Latent Noise, Distribution Type, Sampler Name, and Schedular.
How does the Distribution Type parameter affect the image generated by the Plasma KSampler node?
The Distribution Type parameter controls the type of noise algorithm used, with Default using a Gaussian distribution and Rand using a truly random noise algorithm.
What workflow examples are provided for using Comfy-Plasma?
The document provides workflow examples for using Plasma Sampler with and without Plasma Noise.
